hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Define variables LOG_FILE="/var/log/jenkins/floating_ip_response.log" # Path to the log file FLOATING_IP="172.18.0.100:80" TIMESTAMP=$(date +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
# Get the hostname and remove any carriage return character container_id=$(curl -s -I $FLOATING_IP | grep -i 'container_id' | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d '\r') container_name=$(curl -s -I $FLOATING_IP | grep -i 'container_name' | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d '\r')
# Perform the cURL command and capture runtime using 'time' command { # Log the timestamp, container ID, and container name echo -e "[$TIMESTAMP] Active server:" echo -e "container_id: $container_id" echo -e "container_name: $container_name\n"
echo "Response:"
# Run the cURL command and measure its runtime time curl -s $FLOATING_IP
# Log separator to distinguish different entries echo "---------------------------------------------" echo "" } >> $LOG_FILE 2>&1 # Redirect both stdout and stderr to the log file
